result.execSummary:
The defendant Ja'Veon M Perry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 99 days if revoked.
Upon successful completion of probation DE may renew request for expunction in writing to Court.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent. 
**Pay supervision fees.**
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence. Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine. Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment. Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program, or obtain DED or H.S.E.D. during term of probation.  
**Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.**
**If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.**
**Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.**
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  DE released to Mr. Mitchell in care of the State of Ilinois.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ja'Veon M Perry

defendant.name: Perry, Ja'Veon M
defendant.address: 1118 N East End Ave, Round Lake, IL 60073

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

3:44 PM Defendant Ja'Veon M Perry in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Corcoran in court for Ja'Veon M Perry.  Attorney Alexander Huber in court for State of Wisconsin. Clerk HM.  Court imposes and stays 38 months WSP - 14 months IC and 24 months ES with conditions; DE placed on probation for 2 years with conditions; credit for 99 days if revoked;   DE eligible for CIP but not eligible for SAP; DE to submit DNA sample and pay surcharge - notice given to DE in court.  DE released to care/custody of Mr. Mitchell in State of Illinois.   Appeal Rights, Federal Firearms Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.  DE requests expunction.  Upon successful completion of probation, DE may renew request for expunction in writing to court.  Court may set on for hearing if satisfied with DE's request letter.
IL DCFS rep unable to appear for 10/10 SEH. Attys agree to reschedule to 10/12 3pm. Confirmed with parties by email this day.
Sentencing hearing on October 10, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
9/20/22 hearing rescheduled due to ongoing JT. NTBS.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Alex Huber appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody along w/Atty Jos. Corcoran.  VRC.  Deft's SW from Illinois present; suitable housing has not been located as of yet.  Sentencing hrg adj to 9/20/22 @ 1:30pm to allow add'l time to hopefully locate suitable housing for the deft.

State appears by Attorney Alexander Huber.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Corcoran.   Clerk HMcBride. DE enters guilty plea.  Court finds DE guilty.  Parties waive PSI.  State indicates that the DE is a ward of the State of IL.  If DE released, he will be homeless. State requests adjmt for IL DCFS to determine placement for DE.  SEH 9/6 2pm.  Bond continued.

Defendant Ja'Veon M Perry appeared with Attorney Joseph Corcoran.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order completed and given to Attorney.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
